title: Why is Devanagari script called so? - Quora

response.answer_text: Devanagari script refers to the script used by the merchant community in India.After 300 century AD Tamil Brahmi and Asokan Brahmi scripts came to an end. Merchants switched over to write on silk cloth using colour styles. They employed artists. Artists used their artitstic talent of rounding the letter forms which resulted in different types of script forms of present day written languages in South India and North India.
